rComments: Worst teacher I've ever had. period.  Totally inadequate.  You basically had to teach yourself the course because she really didn't know what she was doing.  Also the midterm was the biggest joke.  Basically none of it was covered in the lectures, and it was only ten questions so if you even got a few wrong that was already a C.

She made me hate a subject i love. I left her class everyday with an immense amount of frustration because there was absolutely no clarity in her lectures and she would reprimand us for asking questions. She clearly is not suited to be a prof, avoid her to save your GPA!

Cynthia is by far the worst professor I have ever had. Not only did she not understand the material, she presented false information. In addition, she wasted countless hours of class time surfing the web to promote her friend's webpages. The test material not only was completely unrelated to the lectures, but also had no correct answer. Avoid Payne

Probably would have been a good class if the teacher was anyone else. Her class was an absolute joke. She tried to cover up her impotence by constantly making everything unclear. She was often corrected, and she reacted childishly. Questions on both her midterm and final had no correct answer (even T/A agreed). Avoid Cynthia Payne at all costs.

Outdated class, talks for years about MIDI and techniques for uploading music over dial-up.  You have to teach yourself in this class, for exams do not give accurate grades for what should be an easy A. Big Risk for anyones GPA

This teacher was brilliant in her own mind. She did not understand the subject she was supposed to be teaching, and her class was a joke. Attendance was mandatory, and she yelled at the class daily for asking her for clarification because of her poor instructions. She constantly disrespected and talked down to the students for correcting her.
